transformed_texts:
I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. The Church is losing followers. I think this is because the Church does not accept many things. They have strong views on issues like gay marriage, abortion and birth control. These views are old-fashioned in some ways. If the Church changed its views, it might not lose its followers.

Some people do not agree with the Church on these issues. They think the Church is wrong. The Church is against abortion. If you are for abortion, you might not feel comfortable in a Church that teaches it is wrong. The same is true for gay marriage. If you believe in gay marriage, you might not want to be in a Church that does not agree with you.

I do not see why priests cannot be married or why there cannot be female priests. The Church says priests are married to God. But everyone else works and has a family life. Priests should be able to do the same.

I think about gay marriage.  I'm not against it.  I believe that people are born a certain way.  They do not choose to be gay.  So, I think it's not fair to blame them for who they are.

Most people are not born gay.  Some are.  They don't have a choice.  I'm straight, and I was born that way.  But some people are born gay, and that's okay.

I don't think it's right to stop people from marrying who they love.  It's like saying that a man and a woman can get married, but two men or two women can't.  That's not fair.

I don't think the federal government should be involved in this issue.  It's not a matter of security or moral values.  It's just a personal issue.  People should be free to make their own choices.

The government should not punish people for who they are.  Gay people are not doing anything wrong.  They should be treated the same as everyone else.

I think gay marriage should be legal. 
Because 
There is no good reason not to. 

Some people think that homosexual couples are a threat to the heterosexual family. 
But 
It's different. 
And 
There are many different aspects to it. 
It's like two sides of the same coin. 
Heads and tails are not the same. 
But 
They are related. 

Gay couples have the same civil rights as everyone else. 
Like 
Property taxes and healthcare. 
Your partner should be able to be with you when you are sick. 
They should be allowed to visit you in the hospital. 

Many studies have been done on gay couples. 
They have the same rates of success as heterosexual couples. 
They have the same factors that make relationships happy. 

It's just a relationship. 
A marriage is a legal document. 
It's not about church and state. 
If people can have a civil union, why not a marriage? 

Separate but unequal is not fair. 

Gay couples are the same in many ways. 
They have the same relationship roles. 
People worry about adoption and community issues. 
They worry about how gay couples will affect the community. 

But 
It's hard to say about adoption. 
Children of gay couples will face problems in school. 
They will be treated badly by their peers and other adults. 

There are schools for children of gay parents in New York City. 
They need these schools because gay children are bullied in regular schools. 

Parenting skills are the same for gay and straight couples. 
They can be community involved or not, like straight couples. 

The government should be involved in this issue. 
They should make gay marriage legal in every state. 

President Bush has strong moral views on this issue. 
He believes it goes against his religion. 
But 
Morality differs from person to person. 
The government should not force its morality on everyone. 

Some people are anti-gay and anti-gay marriage. 
They think gay people are damaged or have a personality defect. 
But 
This is not true. 
The American Psychological Association says so. 

We should listen to experts, not popular opinion. 
If we did, we would see the world differently.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. I think just because a drug is against the law does not mean it has good qualities. So, I think making it available to the public is not a good idea. No, I do not think so. But, I think it should be used for medical purposes. This is because just because a drug is against the law does not mean it is good or bad.

Many drugs against the law are used in pharmacies. For example, oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet are medicines we use all the time. These are controlled substances. But we use them because they are good for people. If we deny the good qualities of marijuana just because it is against the law, that is not fair. We should accept its good qualities.

I do not think marijuana is similar to alcohol. If you misuse marijuana, it can cause problems. But if you misuse alcohol, it can also cause problems. This is a difficult issue. I think we should make marijuana legal, but not all at once. If we do this, people might misuse it. But if we remove the idea that marijuana is a bad thing, people might use it responsibly.

People have a bad idea about marijuana because it is against the law. But marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. So, if we change the way people think about marijuana, people might use it responsibly, especially for medical reasons.

I think the church has changed a lot in the 21st century. It is not as strict as it used to be. When I was a child, I went to church every Sunday. I would wear nice dresses and matching shoes. It was a special event. Later, I went to a private school and saw my friends on weekends. We would go to church together.

Now that I am older, I see that the church has become more casual. They have a shorter service on Sundays. People wear jeans and casual clothes, especially in the summer. Some people even come to church in their beach clothes.

I think the biggest change I have noticed is that people dress more casually. They used to wear nice clothes to church. Now, it is more relaxed.

As for other things, that is what I have noticed about the church I know. I do not know about the politics of the church.

Some people have accused the Catholic Church of not doing enough to stop priests from doing bad things. They say the church should allow women to be priests or priests to get married. But I do not think this would have stopped the bad things from happening. People who do bad things, like hurting children, are not just because they are priests. It is their choice to do bad things. Some people are married and still hurt children.

I also think that when someone becomes a priest, it is their choice. They can choose to be a priest or not. Some other religions allow priests to get married. If someone wants to be married and be a priest, they could choose a different religion.

I think the reason some priests do bad things is because of the way their bodies are made. I think it is a genetic problem. People are born to be a certain way, and getting married will not change that. It might seem like it does not matter, but it is a natural part of who they are. If the church knew about the bad things and covered it up, that is wrong. But I do not think they knew about everything.

I do not have any other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I was not opposed to the idea of going to war in Iraq at first. However, I think the country was still in shock after the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration said Iraq was connected to the attacks and had weapons of mass destruction. But later, we found out that was not true.

I am very upset about the Bush administration's actions. They lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, the former Secretary of State, said he was not convinced by the evidence when he presented it to the United Nations.

I think this is a serious offense. It goes against the principles of the Constitution. The Bush administration has been trying to limit the power of the Constitution since they were in office.

I believe the younger Bush wanted to go to war in Iraq. He wanted to control the Middle East's oil. This is not a good reason to go to war.

I think the war has lasted too long. But I also think it would be bad to leave now. The country might fall into civil war and more people would die.

Now, the United States and the United Nations are working with other countries in the area to try to bring order to Iraq. But I am not sure this is a good idea. Iraq will have problems with its independence.

The government is not working well. The Prime Minister does not have control. There are many groups fighting for power. This is causing a lot of problems.

I do not have any good solutions to these problems.

I have thoughts about the war in Iraq. 

It's hard for me to talk about this. I am not sure where to start. I do not think the war in Iraq makes sense. It is not even a declared war. I think the reason we went to Iraq was because of the attacks on September 11. 

We are still in Iraq, and we are trying to build a democracy. We want to make Iraq like the United States. We also want to get oil from them. But staying in Iraq is causing problems. It makes people there very upset. 

If we stay, we will have to try to build a democracy. This will take a long time.  Building a democracy takes more than a day. If we leave, Iraqis will be mad at us because we made things worse. 

I do not know what to say about the war in Iraq. It is a hard topic. I do not know much about it. 

However, I think the war should end. We do not need to call it a war anymore. We are using guns and being loud to show that we are powerful. But I do not think this is a good reason to stay in Iraq. 

We did not declare war on Iraq in Congress. We should have. I think that is the way it works. We need to declare war in Congress before it starts. 

I think it is a good idea to help Iraq. But it is also a waste of our resources. It makes President Bush look bad. He will be remembered as one of the worst presidents if this war continues. 

The Vietnam War was also not declared, and it is now considered a pointless war. I do not want President Bush to be remembered that way. 

Many families I know have sons and daughters in Iraq. It is hard for me to say that I want the war to end because of them. But I am also worried about the people in Iraq. They have lives and homes, and we have destroyed them. 

If we stay, we will try to change their culture to be like ours. This will not help them. It will make things worse. The hatred towards the U.S. will grow. 

I do not think this war will end soon. It will go on for many years.

I disagree with making marijuana legal. It is not right for a state to say it is legal. The United States Constitution says there must be a separation of church and state. This is clear. It is clearly stated and I think trying to control it would be against the Constitution.

I think those who want to make it illegal are choosing one church's beliefs over another. Many Christians and Catholics do not agree with it. But I don't think the government should decide what is allowed and not allowed for churches.

The separation of church and state is an important part of the Constitution. It allows for religious freedom in the United States. If they made an amendment about it, it would be wrong and go against the Constitution. Also, it would be one of the few amendments that restrict the people, not the government.

I don't think the government should get involved in this issue. I don't see why the president is pushing for this amendment. It seems like it is because of his own personal beliefs as a Catholic. He is showing a preference for one religion over others.

I think it is up to the churches to decide this, not the president or the government. There is no good reason for an amendment to ban it, except for personal views. I don't see how it will affect the economy or anything else. It might actually help the economy and society.

The war in Iraq did not start well. The US government may not have been honest about the reasons for the war. Before the invasion, they tried to link it to the 9/11 attacks. However, this was not true.

I am against war. I think the US government made a mistake by starting a war without being prepared for the consequences. The US removed the Iraqi government. However, they did not plan for the aftermath.

Many American soldiers have died in the war. This is very sad. The US government should have known that removing the government and trying to create a new one would be difficult. They should have learned from their past mistakes, like the Vietnam War.

The US government said they would create a democratic government in Iraq. But this has not happened easily. They are still trying to train the Iraqi military and police. It will take a long time to do this.

I think the US government was not honest about the war. They made it seem easy to implement a new government. But it is not easy. Democracy takes time to develop, and there are often struggles. The US government should have been more careful and honest about the war.

In the 2004 presidential election, I thought about voting for George Bush. One reason was that I wanted him to finish what he started. But now, it is hard to know if we should stay in Iraq. Many American soldiers have died, and it is not clear if it is worth it.

The main reason for the war was to make Iraq a democratic country. But we are not doing this in other countries. I think the real reason is the oil. Iraq has a lot of oil, and the US wants to control it.

The US government also said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But they were not found. Countries like North Korea have these weapons, but the US is not attacking them. I think the US government is not being honest about their decisions.

I hope the war will end soon and there will be peace in Iraq.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I think it's a personal choice. Some people say it's because of biology, not society. I think it's not fair to deny people rights because it's not their choice.

I don't think government should decide this. It's a personal issue. In my neighborhood, I see gay couples living like any other family. They walk their dogs and live like everyone else.

I disagree with President Bush's idea to decide what marriage is. I think it's not his place to decide.

Some people think being homosexual is a chemical thing in the brain. They think it's something you're born with, not something you choose. It's not like having four sisters and no father.

Marriage should be personal, not public. If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it quietly. But if two men or two women want to get married, it's a big issue. I think it should be a personal decision, not a public one.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Anyone can see it. You cannot keep it private.

As a resident advisor, I have dealt with this problem before. When you put something on the internet, it can affect how people think about you. If you talk about violent things, people will think you are serious.

The internet is public. Everyone can see what you write. If you are friends with someone on Myspace, you will see their messages. But the school did not get the message from the school. Someone else did. They had to act on it.

You do not know what to think when you read something on the internet. Some people just joke around. But it could be serious. I think so.

Something happened at school. Someone overheard something and called the school. We found the person who said it. They looked at their Facebook and saw things they wrote that they thought were jokes. But now they are serious.

When you put something on the internet, you have no privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not put it there. You cannot control what people think. You cannot tell them what to take seriously or not.

School officials should not be friends with students on Myspace or Facebook. But if someone brings it to their attention, they have to take it seriously if there is danger.

Teachers should not make a fake account to friend their students. That is the same thing. I do not friend my residents because I do not want to know what they do. If they post pictures of themselves drinking, I do not want to see it.

It is not my job to police them. I do not want that connection.

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The purpose was good at first. 
It was to bring democracy to another country. 
But I think we lost sight of that goal. 
Now we are fighting just to show our power. 
I think the original reason was questionable. 
It started with George Bush's father's problems with Saddam Hussein. 
If the goal was to give democracy to a country without a fair system, that's good. 
But if there were personal reasons, that's not good. 
I think we made our point in the first few months. 
But the war has lasted for years. 
That's too long.

If our goal was to give democracy to a country ruled by a tyrant, that's a good reason for war. 
But I think our goal has changed. 
We're still fighting just to be fighting. 
We don't want to end the war without winning.

I think the war has lasted long enough. 
Their government will have to take care of themselves soon. 
We should stop spending billions of dollars on war. 
We have our own problems, like poverty, that we should be spending money on. 
War is not good for our economy. 
We should spend money on things like roads, schools and health care.

I think that's all I want to say.

Can I ask a question to clarify something?

Someone used the internet to find information that stopped a life from being lost. This happened because the person had put the information on Myspace.

If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you must be friends with someone to see their profile. But if you accept someone as a friend, you give them permission to see your profile.

So, anytime you put information on the internet, you should know many people will see it.

In this case, I think it was good that someone saw that information and stopped a life from being lost.

But it is hard to say if this is right. We cannot have one person watching everyone's profiles all day to prevent problems. This could be unfair to some students. It is not right to have someone's job just to look at people's profiles.

It depends on why they were looking at the profile. Were they looking for something specific or just looking randomly? I do not know.

I have a Facebook account, but I know it bothers me that there are people who can see things about me. I saw a TV show about someone who wanted to show how easy it is to get information. He got a girl's screen name and was talking to her on instant messenger in less than a minute. Some people in my classes know my screen name and I do not recognize them. They IM me and they know my interests, what I look like, and where I am during the day. It is hard to limit what I put on the internet because I want to communicate with my friends.

But at the same time, I am worried about who can see what I put on the internet. I only accept people I know. However, you never know who can look at what you put on the internet.

I heard that my roommate's high school banned students from having Myspace. I do not know if that is a privacy issue, but I am not sure how the school officials had the right to tell students they could not have Myspace.

That is my only other thought on this subject.

I have mixed feelings about the Iraq War. I do not like talking about it because I do not want to be like everyone else. But I think it is not important anymore. Most people think it was a bad idea. The US government did not agree. They do not want to admit they made a mistake.

We can see this in the polls. In the US, Iraq, and around the world, most people think the war was a bad idea. Eighty percent of the Iraqis think so. Most US soldiers in Iraq also think it was a bad idea. They want to leave within a year.

I do not know what to say about this. The situation in Iraq is very difficult. It was already a problem before we came. Now it is even worse. We cannot just leave or stay without causing more problems.

I think the main problem is the difference in culture between the US and the Middle East. We think we can bring democracy, but the people of Iraq may not want it. We should think about the pros and cons before making a decision. We went to Iraq and now it is a disaster.

I do not see a good reason for us to stay in Iraq. If we want to leave slowly, that's okay. But I do not think we should stay any longer than we have to. Most Iraqis want us to leave within a year. We should listen to them.

If something goes wrong after we leave, we can say we gave them a chance to make their own decisions. If we stay and make things worse, we will not be seen as good guys. But we will be better than we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.  It's not just about women, but also about the kind of work you do.

For overall, I think women have it harder because of the "glass ceiling." Even though we say there is equality, it's hard for people to work under a woman. This is because of how society was raised for so long.

Many times, women see a job they can do and have the qualifications for it. But maybe the board won't promote them to that position because historically, women aren't in powerful business jobs.

Men also face discrimination in certain fields, like fashion. It's rare to have a male parent staying at home. Society often looks down on this because they think men should be working and making money.

This can be hard on men who want to stay home with their children. Perhaps the wife has a better job and it works out fine, but society still looks down on them.

In the fashion industry, people often don't take men seriously if they're straight. This might be because men who like fashion often have different styles of life. If a man is in fashion and has a typical style, people might wonder if he really knows what fashion is for women.

Depending on the kind of work you do, I think there is definitely gender discrimination in the U.S.

Changing this is hard because society has a set way of thinking. We've made progress since the 1800s, but change is slow. If we keep working at our current pace, I think we can make progress. Women are becoming CEOs and getting accepted in business, and more men are becoming stay-at-home dads.

As people learn more about others, they become more accepting. To promote this, we need to show the good qualities of people who are stereotyped against. If we force change, people will resist. We're at a good balance now, and change is happening slowly.

I'm not sure what else we can do that isn't already being done. If we do it too fast, people will resist. We've made progress, and change takes time.

People can also be discriminated against based on where they're from. If someone grows up on a farm and doesn't have the best grammar, but is intelligent and works their way up to a CEO job, other men might look down on them.

So, people can be discriminated against based on gender, where they're from, and other things. I think this is another example.

The government in California changed the law about marijuana. Now, it is not a big crime to have some marijuana. You can get a ticket instead of going to jail. This is called decriminalization.

This means that people who are caught with marijuana will not have to go to jail. They will not have to pay a lot of money for fines and lawyers. This can save a lot of money for the city.

Some people think this is a good idea. They say it will help cities that are running out of money. They can use the money they save to help people.

One city in Colorado, Denver, made this change. Now they have more money to help people. They can use it for schools, for old people, and for people who do not have enough to eat.

But not everyone agrees with this change. Some people think marijuana should not be allowed. They think it is bad for people to use it.

If marijuana is made legal, it could be sold in stores like cigarettes. People could smoke it anywhere. This could be a problem because some people drive cars while smoking marijuana. It could be bad for them.

Some people think alcohol is worse than marijuana. Alcohol can hurt a person's ability to drive. Marijuana can also hurt a person's ability to make good decisions.

But people are different. How they react to marijuana is different. Some people can use it and be fine. Others cannot use it at all.

So, it is hard to say if marijuana is good or bad. It depends on the person.

I am not sure about this issue. I have not made a decision yet. I do not know if either side is right or wrong. But I think this is a very difficult problem to solve. It is hard to separate the government from the church. And it is hard to define marriage without hurting someone's feelings.

Marriage is considered a sacred thing by many people. If it is a marriage, then the government should not ask about the kind of marriage it is. It should just look at it as a union between two people.

If two people are in a union, they should be treated the same as everyone else. The government should not care about what kind of union it is.

I think if all the states agree on this issue, it should be made a law across the country. But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is not a good idea. It is a big problem for some people, but it is not big enough to change the constitution.

It is not important enough to change the constitution just to define marriage. It should not be changed to take away someone's right to get married.

I was raised in a Christian home. This makes homosexuality a bit confusing for me. I have many friends who are gay. I do not agree with their lifestyle, but I think it should be allowed. I do not think it should be a national issue. I believe each state should decide for itself.

Some states are democratic, some are Republican. Democratic states tend to support gay marriage. If you live in a state that supports gay marriage, you should respect that decision. You chose to live there. I think homosexuals should have the same chances as heterosexuals. Each state should decide about gay marriage.

I think some things should be left to each state. President Bush will not live in every state, so he should not decide how each state should work. I do not agree with this. First, Myspace is a public thing. If you post something on the internet, you must be prepared for others to see it. This includes school officials. Even if the post is not made under the school's name, they can still find it. They can look at it in their homes.

In a situation like a school shooting, I think it is okay for school officials to search for information on the internet. If it helps keep students safe, then it is a good thing. It is a responsibility of the school to keep students safe.

If school officials look at a student's Myspace page just to see if they are doing something they should not, that is an invasion of privacy. But if they are trying to make the school a safer place, then I do not think that is an invasion.

It is a public thing, and if you do something on the internet, it can come back to hurt you. If you post something bad about someone, you should not put it on an email. You never know who might see it.

If you do something wrong when you are a student, it can come back to haunt you when you are older. Once something is on the internet, it is hard to get rid of it. You can get in trouble for things you did a long time ago.

If school officials have a good reason to look at a student's Myspace page, then it is okay. But they should not just look at it to catch students. They should only look at it if it will make the school a safer place.

When parents send their children to school, they want them to be safe. That is why the school officials looked at the Myspace page. They wanted to make sure the school was safe, like they do with lockdown drills.

The school officials did what was necessary to keep students safe. They looked at the Myspace page to prevent something bad from happening, like a school shooting. We practiced lockdown drills in my school to make sure we were safe.

That is all I have to say on this.

I have mixed feelings about the war in Iraq. I was for it at first because of what happened on 9/11. I felt we needed to strike back. But as time went on, I realized we were not prepared. We didn't have a clear plan.

I think we made things worse. We went to war without thinking about the future. We just acted out of emotion and anger. This led to more problems.

I don't think we should be in Iraq. They are fighting among themselves. As long as they are fighting each other, they won't attack us.

I don't care about what happens in Iraq. I don't think they are able to work together. They are not like us. War is very different for them.

I think we just wanted revenge after 9/11. President Bush said we needed to go to war with Iraq. He declared war, but I think he didn't have a clear plan.

We should have left Iraq alone. We can't stay there forever. If we leave, things will get worse. We are hurting ourselves by staying.

We have made some progress, but not enough. We should go home and let them deal with their problems. We can't change them. They will always be the way they are.

transformed_texts:
I think the Catholic Church needs to change in a few ways. Their views are not very accepting of many things. For example, the Church is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. They have strong views on these issues, but they are a bit old-fashioned. If the Church were to change its views and be more modern, it might not lose its followers.

Many people are starting to disagree with the Church on certain subjects. They see the Church's views as wrong. The Church is against abortion, but if you are for it, you might not want to be part of a Church that teaches it is wrong. The same is true for gay marriage. If you believe in it, you might not want to be part of a Church that does not agree.

I do not see why priests cannot be married or have female priests. But I do not know if this would have prevented some of the problems the Church has faced. If priests were allowed to be married, would they have acted differently? It is hard to say.

I do not see why priests cannot have a family life. Everyone else in the world works and has a family. Priests can devote their life to God, but they can also have a family. I do not see why this is not possible.

I'm not against gay marriage. I think people should not be punished for their sexual orientation. It is not a choice. People are born that way.

Gay people should not be blamed for how they are. It's not something they can change. I don't think it's fair to say a man and a woman can get married, but two people of the same sex cannot.

I haven't thought a lot about this issue, but I think it's wrong to say that. People are not born with a choice about their sexual orientation. It's just how they are.

I don't think the federal government should be involved in this issue. It's not a matter of law or morality. I don't think they should tell people who they can or cannot marry.

I don't think gay people should be blamed or punished for being who they are. They should not be treated unfairly. The federal government should not interfere in people's personal lives.

It's a person's choice who they love and who they marry. The government should not stop them.

I think the federal government is not in its place in this issue. It's not about the country's security or morals. It's just about people's personal lives.

People should be free to choose who they love and marry. They should not be punished for being gay.

I think gay marriage should be allowed. 

Because 
There is no good reason not to. 

Many people think gay couples are a threat to the family. But this is not true. 

Gay couples are different from straight couples. And they have different needs. 

It's like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are not the same. But they are connected. 

Gay couples have the same rights as straight couples. They should have the right to get married. 

If a gay couple gets sick, their partner can't visit them in the hospital. They are not considered family. 

This is unfair. If you spend your life with someone, they should be able to visit you when you are sick. 

Many studies have shown that gay couples are just like straight couples. They have the same reasons for a happy relationship. 

Gay couples are not asking to get married in a church. They want a marriage certificate from the government. 

If the government gives a civil union, why not a marriage? 

This is like segregation - separate but unequal. 

People worry about adoption and how a gay couple will affect the community. But people are the same no matter if they are gay or straight. 

They have the same roles in a relationship. They love each other and want to be together. 

But people are afraid of change. They don't know what to expect. 

In New York City, they have special schools for kids of gay parents. Because they get bullied in public schools. 

Gay couples can be good parents. They can be community involved like straight couples. 

It's about personality, not gay or straight. 

I think the government should be involved in making gay marriage legal. The federal government should make it legal in every state. 

I think the amendment to ban gay marriage is wrong. It's based on personal morality, but morality is different for everyone. 

The government should not make laws based on one group's morality. It's unfair to ignore other people's views. 

The government should be fair to everyone. It should not make laws that enforce one group's standards on the whole country. 

Many people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are damaged or have a defect. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so. 

We should listen to experts, not just what our friends and neighbors say. 

If we listened to experts, we would see the world differently.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. I see many drugs that are against the law, but they are still useful. For example, oxycotton and Vicodin are two of them. We use them because they are helpful. Some people think that just because a drug is against the law, it is not useful. But that is not true.

I think marijuana should be available for medical use. If a drug is against the law, it does not mean it is not helpful. We should use it if it helps people. 

Marijuana is not like alcohol. If you use too much of either one, it can cause problems. But some people think that if we make marijuana legal, people will use it more. I do not think that is true. If we remove the idea that marijuana is bad, people might use it responsibly.

People have a bad idea about marijuana because it is against the law. But it is not as bad as other drugs like heroin or cocaine. If we change the way we think about marijuana, people might use it for medical reasons. 

I do not think we should make marijuana legal all at once. We should do it slowly and carefully. This way, people will not use it too much.

I think the church has changed to fit the 21st century. It's not as strict as it used to be. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday. I had to wear nice dresses and matching shoes and a purse. It was a big deal.

As I grew older, the church made some changes. They now have a shorter mass for teenagers. It's just 30 minutes long. People dress more casually now, especially in the summer. They wear beach clothes or jeans and khakis.

I think this change is positive. It makes the church more welcoming to people. I don't know much about the church's politics, but that's my opinion.

Some people accuse the Catholic Church of covering up pedophilia cases. I don't think changing the church's rules would have stopped these problems. There are men who are married and still become pedophiles. It's not because of the church's rules that they become pedophiles.

I think when men become priests, they choose to do so. They know the rules of the church. If they want to get married, they could choose a different faith. Some churches allow priests to be married.

I think pedophilia is based on genetics. People are born this way. It's not because of how they are raised. The church can't change that. If they knew about the problems and covered them up, that's wrong. But I think in many cases, they didn't know.

I don't have any other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I was okay with the idea of going to war. But I think many Americans were still very upset about the September 11 attacks. I think the Bush administration went to war because of a false story. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true.

I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. They said Saddam Hussein was connected to Osama Bin Laden and the September 11 attacks. But this was not true.

I am very upset about this. I think the Bush administration has broken the law. They should own up to their mistake. Even Colin Powell, who presented a report to the UN, now says he was not sure about the evidence.

I think the Bush administration does not respect the US Constitution. They want to control the country. I think they wanted to go to war from the beginning.

One official, the Secretary of the Treasury, wrote a book saying the younger Bush wanted to go to war because he was angry with Saddam Hussein. He also wanted to control Iraq's oil.

I think the war has gone on too long. But if we leave now, more people may die. The country may fall into civil war.

The UN and the US are working together to find a new way. They want a group of countries from the area to help Iraq. But I am not sure this is a good idea. Iraq's government is very weak. The country may not be able to govern itself.

The current government in Iraq is not working well. The Prime Minister does not have much power. A man named Mugtada al-Sadr has a lot of influence. His party has many seats in the Parliament. I think the government is having trouble because of these problems.

I have thoughts about the war in Iraq. At first, I think it's pointless. It's not a war that was officially declared by the US Congress. I think it's more about getting back at Iraq because they are blamed for the September 11 attacks.

I don't really know the details, but I know that we're staying in Iraq to help them build a democracy and also to get oil from them. But this is not a good reason to stay. It makes many people unhappy.

If we stay, we have to build democracy, which takes a long time. If we leave, Iraqis will be upset because we made things bad for them. They will have to start over.

I don't know what to say about this topic. It's hard for me to talk about. 

I think the war should continue, but not be called a war. I think we use guns to show that we are strong and powerful. But we didn't officially declare war on Iraq, which is not right.

I think it's a good idea to help Iraq, but we should not waste our resources. I feel bad for President Bush because the war is making him look bad.

The Vietnam War was also not officially declared, and it's now called a meaningless war. I don't want the same thing to happen with Iraq.

It's hard for me to say that I want the war to end. Many families I know have sons and daughters in Iraq, and I don't want them to be in danger. But it's hard to stay in Iraq because we have a different culture and we might try to change them into a second United States, which would be bad for them.

I think the whole situation will last for many years. That's my opinion.

I do not agree that it is right to make marijuana legal. I think it is up to the churches and the Constitution. The Constitution says there must be a separation of church and state. This means the government should not decide what is right or wrong for a church. It should let the churches decide.

The Constitution is very clear on this. It says that the government must not interfere with the churches. If the government tries to enforce laws about marijuana, it would be against the Constitution. This would be wrong.

Some people who want to make marijuana illegal are choosing the rules of one church over another. Most Catholics and Christians do not support marijuana. But this does not mean that the government should decide what the churches can and cannot make illegal.

Separation of church and state is a key part of the Constitution. This allows for religious freedom in the United States. Even if someone wanted to make an amendment to the Constitution, it would be wrong. An amendment would change what is already written. It would also be against the idea of freedom.

I do not think any government should control this issue. The government should not push for an amendment to ban marijuana. This would show that the government prefers one religion over others.

The government should let the churches decide about marijuana. There is no good reason for the government to get involved. It would be based on personal views, not facts. I do not see how making marijuana illegal would help the economy. It might even help it.

In conclusion, I disagree with making marijuana legal. I think it is up to the churches and the Constitution. The government should not interfere with what the churches decide.

The war in Iraq was a very difficult decision. I do not think the government was honest with the American people about the reasons for the war. Before invading Iraq, the government tried to link the invasion to the terrorist attacks of September 11th. However, the two events were not closely related.

I am against war, especially a preemptive strike. I think the war in Iraq is like the Vietnam War. The government did not learn from its past mistakes.

Many American soldiers have died in the war. The government did not prepare for the aftermath of removing the Iraqi government. They did not plan for the power vacuum and chaos that would follow.

The US government tried to impose a democratic government on Iraq. This was similar to what they tried to do in Vietnam. They wanted to push out Communists and create a democratic government.

The US government should have known that the war would be long and hard. It would not be a clear victory like in many other wars. In Vietnam, the US was fighting an army, not the people. It is hard to defeat people who are fighting for their country.

I think the government was not prepared for the war. They did not plan for all possible outcomes. They did not think about what would happen after they removed the Iraqi government.

We are still in Iraq today, and many American soldiers are still dying. We are trying to train the Iraqi army and police to be able to police their own country. This is a long process.

I think the government tried to deceive the American people by making them think the war would be short and successful. But it takes years to implement a new form of government and make it successful.

In our own country, democracy was a long struggle. There was civil war and tension before we had a powerful government. The US government made the war in Iraq seem like an easy thing to do. But it is not easy.

It is hard to decide whether to stay in Iraq or leave. We took away their government and way of life. It is hard to abandon them now. But there are many American casualties, and it is hard to know how many is too many.

One of the reasons for invading Iraq was the claim that they had weapons of mass destruction. But no such weapons were ever found. We are getting oil from Iraq, and it is often about money and controlling resources.

Let's hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq. But it will probably take time.

I am in favor of gay marriage. I have been for it for a long time. I think it's a personal choice. Many scientists now say it's not just a matter of how people are raised, but also because of their biology. This means people should not be treated unfairly because of something they cannot control.

I think it's not right for the government to tell people what to do in their personal lives. The issue of gay marriage is not just a state or national problem, but a personal issue. In my neighborhood, I see gay couples living normal lives. They walk their dogs and do the same things as other families.

I don't think President Bush has the right to decide what marriage means. I think his views are old-fashioned. Scientists have found that some people are born gay because of a chemical difference in their brains. This has nothing to do with how they were raised.

One of the reasons people are against gay marriage is that it seems unnatural. But it's not just about that. If a man and woman want to get married, they can do it in secret. But if two men or two women want to get married, it's a big public issue.

I think marriage should be a personal matter, not something the government should decide. It's not the government's business what people do in their private lives.

No, I don't have any other thoughts on this issue.

You put something on the internet, it is public. People can see it. You cannot control who sees it. When you post something, it can affect how people think of you.

As a resident advisor, I have had to deal with this before. You put something on the internet, and it can hurt you. If you talk about violence or shootings, people will see it. They will think you are serious.

The internet is public. Everyone can see it. If your friends have you on Myspace or Facebook, they will see the bulletin. The school has to act on it. They cannot ignore it.

But, you do not know what is real and what is not. Some people play jokes. They may say something to see how people react. It could be like an experiment gone wrong.

In our school, something happened. Someone overheard something, and they called the school. We found out who said it, and it was not a joke. He had things on his Facebook that were serious. When you put things on the internet, you have no control. If you do not want people to see it, do not put it there.

If someone looks at your Facebook or Myspace, it is not an invasion of privacy. You gave them access to it. If there is danger, the school has to take it seriously.

But, school officials should not be friends with students on the internet. They should not look at your private messages or phone calls. If it is brought to their attention, it is different.

Do not friend your residents on the internet. You do not want to know what they are doing. It is not your place. You do not want to have to deal with it.

I think the war has gone on for too long. 
Its purpose was good at the beginning. 
It was to restore democracy in another country. 
But now, I think we have lost sight of that purpose. 
We are fighting for reasons that are not clear. 
Maybe we fight just to show we are strong. 

I think the original reason was not fair. 
The war was started by the U.S. president George Bush's father. 
He had a problem with Saddam Hussein. 
If the goal was to give democracy to a country without a fair government, that would be a good reason. 
But if there were personal reasons, that would not be fair. 

I think we got our message across at the start of the war. 
But it has been going on for too long. 
Many years have passed, and we are still fighting. 
That is not fair to the people of the country we are fighting for. 

If our goal was to help a country ruled by a bad leader, that would be a good reason for war. 
But I do not think that is why we are fighting now. 
I think our reason for fighting has changed. 
We are fighting just because we are fighting. 

I think the war should end. 
The country's government will have to take care of itself soon. 
We have many problems in our own country that need money. 
We have poverty and need to fix our roads and schools. 
We should spend our money on these things, not on a long war. 

Many billions of dollars are being spent on the war. 
We do not need to spend so much money on war. 
We can use that money to help our own people. 
It is not right to spend our money on a war that we are not winning. 

I think that is all I want to say.

I have a question. Can I ask for more information about something?

Someone was able to prevent a bad thing from happening because they looked at some information on the internet. They saw it on a website called Myspace. If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you have to ask someone to be your "friend" to see their information. But when you accept someone as a friend, you are giving them permission to see your information.

I think it is good that someone was able to see that information and stop a bad thing from happening.

But it is also a problem. We can't have one person watching all of the students' information all the time. That would be unfair. It would be like picking out some students to watch and not others.

I don't think it is a good idea to have someone's job be to look at people's information on the internet. But it depends on why they were looking at it.

I have a Facebook account, and it bothers me that there are people who can see my information. I saw a TV show about a man who was looking at people's information on the internet. He was able to find a girl's screen name and talk to her on the computer. It was scary.

Some of my friends and I have talked about this problem. We know that people can see a lot of our information on the internet. We can limit what we put up, but it's hard. We want to be able to communicate with our friends, but we don't want to share too much information.

I heard that a school my roommate went to banned students from having Myspace. I don't know if that is a good idea. I don't think the school had the right to tell students what they can and cannot do on the internet.

I want to talk about the Iraq War. I feel bad saying this, but it's not really important anymore. The whole country thinks it was a bad idea. The government in the United States did not agree, but most people did.

New polls show that seventy-five percent of the people in the world think the war was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqi people think the same. Most of the American soldiers in Iraq also think the war was a bad idea and they want to leave within one year.

The war has been a disaster since the beginning. Iraq was already in trouble before the United States came in. Now, leaving the country is also a problem. There is no easy solution to problems in the Middle East.

The United States and the Middle East have different cultures. The American government thinks it can bring democracy to Iraq, but the people of Iraq do not want this. Saddam Hussein was a bad leader, but is it worth invading another country?

Before going to war, we should think about the pros and cons. The war has caused many problems in Iraq. We should weigh these problems against the reasons for staying. I do not see a good reason to stay in Iraq. If the government wants to leave slowly, I would not have a problem with that. But I do not see a reason to stay any longer than we should.

Many Iraqis want the United States to leave. At least eighty percent of them think we should leave within one year. These are the people we are trying to help. If they tell us to leave, we should listen.

If we leave and things get worse, we can say we tried to help but they did not want our help. We can try to help again later, but we will at least be the good guys. Well, not really good guys, but better than we are now.

I think there is still a problem with gender equality in the United States. It's not just about women, though. The problem is different in different jobs. 

For example, in some areas, women have a harder time getting ahead. This is because society has been taught for a long time that men should be in charge. So, when a woman applies for a job, people may not choose her because of this idea.

The same thing happens with men. For example, in the fashion industry, men who like fashion may be looked down on. People may think they don't know what fashion is for women.

It's also true for stay-at-home dads. People may think it's strange for a man to stay home and take care of children. But this is changing. More and more men are staying home to raise their kids, and people are starting to accept this.

In fields like fashion, people are starting to listen to women's opinions. But it takes time for change to happen. We have to be careful not to push too hard, or people will resist. We've made progress, and change takes time.

It's not just about gender, either. People from different places or with different backgrounds may be discriminated against in the same way. For example, a man from a rural area who has a good education but poor grammar may be looked down on by others. They may think he's not smart because of his grammar.

So, we have to work slowly and carefully to make change. We've made progress, and people are starting to accept women in charge and stay-at-home dads. But it's not easy, and it takes time.

They did not make marijuana legal. They made it not a crime to have it. It's like a traffic ticket now. You can get in trouble, but it's not as bad as before.

If you get in trouble for marijuana, it can affect your life in some ways. It can affect your job and other things. This is a big problem for some people.

But some people say it's better to not make it a crime. It costs a lot to arrest and jail people. It costs money to bring them to court and to pay lawyers and judges.

Some cities don't want to make this change. They don't want marijuana in their city. But some cities, like Denver, are different. They are more open to new ideas.

In Denver, they have more money now to spend on things like education and food for people who need it. This is good.

Marijuana is not something we want everywhere. But it's also not something we want to ignore. There are good reasons to think about this issue carefully.

If marijuana is legal, people might smoke it and drive. That's a big problem. And some people would smoke it in public, and that would be awkward.

Alcohol is bad for you too. It can affect your driving and your decisions. Marijuana can affect your lifestyle and your decisions too.

No two people react the same to substances. Some people can handle things well, and some people cannot. It's hard to know what to do.

Both marijuana and alcohol have bad effects. I think they should be treated carefully.

I would say yes to changing the Catholic Church. 
Because many of the things they do are old and do not change. 
They do things the same way for a long time. 
It is good to have traditions, but it is also important to change. 

A lot of Catholics go to church every week. 
They are strict about how things are done. 
Sometimes I feel that the Catholic Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules exactly. 
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. 
They also do not accept people of other religions. 

For example, my parents were married in a different church because my mom was Catholic and my dad was not. 
The Catholic Church would not marry them because of my dad's religion. 
This is not being tolerant of other religions. 
We are taught to love others, but the Catholic Church does not act this way. 

I think some Catholic teachings are good, but the way the Church acts is not always right. 
The Church continues to do things the old way, even if it is not good. 

I do not think that allowing priests to marry would stop them from being bad to children. 
People who harm children will do it no matter what. 
It is not the same as being married to a spouse. 

So, I do not think that allowing priests to be married would help.

I am not sure about this issue. I do not have a strong opinion yet. It is a difficult topic. The separation of church and state and the definition of marriage make it hard to decide without hurting anyone's feelings. I do not know. I think that civil unions could be a good idea. Marriage is a sacrament for some people. If you are married, you should be equal in the eyes of the law. A civil union is just two people who are together.

I think it is better to have a civil union instead of marriage. This way, the government does not have to get involved with the kind of marriage it is. The government should not care if people are baptized or not.

I do not think that gay marriage should be a problem. It is two people who love each other and want to be together. They should have the same rights as everyone else.

If all the states can agree on something, it should be made into a federal law. A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. It is a small issue and not big enough to change the constitution.

I do not think it is important to change the constitution to ban gay marriage. It is not a big enough issue.

No.

I was raised in a Christian home. But I have gay friends. This makes homosexuality a difficult issue for me. I don't agree with all of its ideas. However, I think it should be allowed. It's not a national problem. Each state should decide.

Some states are democratic. Some are republican. Democratic states will support gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know how they feel. I don't think you should disagree with their decision. You chose to live there.

I think homosexuals should have the same rights as heterosexuals. Therefore, they should be allowed to marry based on each state's decision.

I already said that.

I don't think President Bush should make a decision about gay marriage for the whole country. Each state should decide its own rules.

I don't think gay marriage should be banned. I think the president should not decide how each state runs itself. He doesn't live in every state. He should not decide for them.

I think some things should be left up to each state. The president will not be in office for long. If a new president wants to change the law, it will be changed. But each state should decide its own rules. They will live with the decision, not the president.

No, I don't have any other answer.

I do not agree with the school officials checking Myspace.  Myspace is a public website.  If you post something on it, others can see it.  This includes school officials.

If you post something on Myspace, you should not expect to keep it private.  It is easy to find things on the internet.  If you write something bad about someone, do not put it in an email.  Emails can come back to haunt you.

Once something is on the internet, it is always there.  If you do something bad, you will get in trouble.  School officials should not go on the internet just to catch students.  But if they find something that makes the school safer, that is okay.

Schools have to keep students safe.  They have to be prepared for things like school shootings.  Schools have drills to prepare for emergencies.  School officials checked Myspace to keep the school safe.  They were not doing it just to catch students.

We had safety drills in my high school.  We practiced what to do in case of emergencies.  This was to keep the school safe.  School officials checked Myspace for the same reason.

They wanted to prevent a tragedy like Columbine.  I think that is a good reason to check Myspace.  That is all I have to say.

I was for the war at first. I was affected by 9/11. I wanted to help. But now I am against the war. We went to war without a plan. We did not think about the long-term effects. We did not prepare well.

I think we made a big mistake. The people in that country are fighting with each other. They cannot be friends with us if they cannot be friends with themselves. I do not care about what happens there. They are fighting with each other and cannot take care of themselves.

War is different for them than it is for us. They are savage when they fight. They do not want to make their country better. They just want us to leave.

I think we were looking for revenge. President Bush wanted to go to war because people were angry. He declared war on Iraq without a plan. We did not have a choice, but we could have done it better. We should have had a clear plan to create order.

We did not work together. We did not know what we were doing. I think emotion and anger led us to war. That's what we created in that country. We are not the ones to change those people. They will always be like that.

We are not making enough progress. We made some progress, but it's not enough to stay. The country will collapse when we leave. We are hurting ourselves by staying. We should just leave.
