transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are leaving the Church because it is not very accepting of some things. The Church has strong views on issues like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old and not liked by many. If the Church changes its views, it will not lose its followers.

Some people are against the Church because of its views on these issues. They think the Church is wrong. The Church does not allow women to be priests and priests cannot be married. Many people think this is unfair. They believe everyone should have their own family and life outside of their job.

The Church says priests are married to God, but they do not need a family. However, this is not true for everyone else. Most people have jobs and families. They must balance work and family life. Priests should be able to do the same. 

The Church needs to be more open-minded and accept different views. This will help it keep its followers. The Church should not be against things that many people support, like gay marriage and birth control.

If the Church allows priests to be married and have families, it might not have had some problems. However, it is hard to know for sure. The Church's rules are very old and do not fit with modern society.

In the end, the Church should be more accepting of different views and allow priests to be married and have families. This will help it keep its followers and be more like other jobs and families.

I am not against gay marriage. I believe people are born the way they are, and it is not a choice. I think gay people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. I do not think it is fair to say one man and one woman can get married, but two people of the same sex cannot.

I do not think people have a choice in their sexual orientation. I was born straight, and others are born gay. It does not seem to be a decision they make.

I do not think the federal government should be involved in this issue. I do not see it as a matter of law or a moral issue. I do not think gay people should be judged or punished for being who they are.

I believe the government should stay out of people's private lives. It has nothing to do with the safety of the country. I do not see why they need to get involved. Gay people are who they are, and they should not be blamed for it.

I think gay marriage should be legalized. There is no good reason not to.

Some people think gay couples are a threat to the heterosexual family. But they are different. It's like two sides of the same coin. Heads will never be tails, but they are the same thing.

Gay couples have many of the same rights as others. They should be able to own property and get medical help when they are sick. But now, they can't be with their partner in the hospital.

This is not fair. A lot of scientific studies have been done on gay couples and they are just like other couples. They have the same things that make a relationship successful.

The problem is that some people don't want to let gay couples get married. They think it's against their religion. But the government should not be involved in church business. If a gay couple wants a marriage certificate, that's all they are asking for.

Just like the civil rights movement, this is about being separate but equal. Gay couples are the same as others in many ways.

Some people are worried about adoption and how it will affect the community. But this is not a good reason to deny gay couples the right to marry. They can be parents just like anyone else.

Children of gay couples are just like other children. They are influenced by their parents, but their parents' sexual orientation does not affect their parenting skills.

I think the government should be involved in making gay marriage legal in every state. The amendment to ban gay marriage is not right.

President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. He thinks it's against his religion. But his views are not the only ones that matter. Morality is different for everyone.

It's not right for the government to enforce one group's morality on the whole country. The government should be fair and equal for everyone.

Some people believe that gay people are damaged or have a personality defect. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so.

We should listen to experts and not just what our friends and neighbors think. If we do, we will see the world in a different way.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. 
I think a drug's legal status does not decide if it is useful. 
So, if a drug is bad, it is bad, no matter if it is legal or not. 
I do not think marijuana should be available for the public. 
No, I do not think that. 
But, I do think it should be used for medical purposes. 
Because a drug is bad does not mean it has no good properties. 
There are many bad drugs that we use in the hospital. 
Like oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets. 
These are controlled substances, but they are useful. 
If we deny the good properties of marijuana just because it is illegal, that is not right. 

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. 
Abusing marijuana is bad, like abusing alcohol. 
But, if we make marijuana legal, people might use it responsibly. 
We should remove the bad image of marijuana first. 
Then, people might use it responsibly. 

People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. 
But, it is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. 
If we change people's image of marijuana, they might use it responsibly. 
And, it should be available for medical purposes.

The Catholic church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as it was before. I grew up going to church every Sunday. I would wear nice dresses and matching shoes. After I moved to a private school, I saw my friends there on weekends. We would attend church together.

Now, as I've grown older, the church has made some changes. They now have a shorter service, thirty minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. Some families come to church in beach clothes. Even in the morning services, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I've noticed is in the church I attend. I don't know much about the church's politics, but this is my experience.

Some people have accused the Catholic church of not doing enough to stop priests who commit pedophilia. People think that if the church allowed female priests or priests to get married, these problems might have been avoided.

I don't think this would have made a difference. There are married men who become pedophiles. It's the person, not the rules that cause the problem. When someone decides to become a priest, it's their choice. There are other religions that allow priests to get married, so if they want to get married, they can choose a different faith.

I think pedophilia is based on genetics. People are born with it, not made that way through upbringing. You can't change it by getting married. It may come out eventually. I don't think the church could have stopped this from happening. If they knew about it and tried to cover it up, that's wrong. But I don't think they always knew.

I don't have other thoughts about the Catholic church.

I was okay with the idea of going to war in Iraq at first. But I think everyone was still upset after the September 11th attacks. We went to war for reasons that I do not agree with.

The Bush administration connected the war to Osama Bin Laden and the September 11th attacks. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true.

This made me very upset. I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. It was not honest with us.

Even Colin Powell, the Secretary of State, said he was not convinced by the evidence when he presented it at the United Nations. This is wrong. It is a serious crime for the government to lie to its people.

I think the Bush administration does not care about the Constitution. They have been trying to weaken it since 2001.

The administration wanted to go to war for a long time. One of the Treasury Secretaries said in his book that President Bush was angry at Saddam Hussein because of his father. He wanted to expand our oil supply.

I think the war has gone on too long. But if we leave now, many more people may die. The country may fall into civil war.

The United States and the United Nations are trying a new plan. They want other countries in the area to help bring order to Iraq. But I am not sure this will work. Iraq's government may be weak and unable to control the country.

The news says the Parliament is not working well. The Prime Minister does not have much control. There are many groups fighting for power.

I do not have a solution to this problem.

I have some thoughts about the war in Iraq.  At this point, I think it is pointless.  It is not even a declared war.  I think it was started as a way to get back at Iraq because of the attacks on September 11.  I don't really know much about the war, but I know we are staying there to try and build a democracy.  We also want to get oil from them.

But I don't think it is worth it because it is making everyone upset.  If we stay, we have to try and build democracy, which will take a long time.  If we leave, they will be angry with us because we made their country bad.

I think the war should not be called a war anymore.  I think we are staying there to show that we are big and powerful.  But this is not a good reason to stay.

I do think we should try to help the people of Iraq.  But it is also wasting our resources.  The war is making President Bush look bad.  He is being compared to the president who started the Vietnam War, which was also not declared.

I know some families who have sons and daughters in Iraq.  I want the war to end, but I also don't want to leave them there.  It is hard to decide what to do.  If we stay, we might make things worse for the people of Iraq.

I think the war will go on for a long time.  It is a complicated issue.

I do not think it is right for a state to make marijuana legal. I think this is a matter for the churches. The United States Constitution says there must be a separation of church and state. This is clear. It is written in the Constitution. I think trying to make laws about marijuana would be against what the Constitution says.

Some people are against making marijuana illegal. They think it is a matter of which church you believe in. Many Catholics are against marijuana. They do not want it to be legal. But I do not think the government should decide what the churches can and cannot make illegal.

The idea of separation of church and state is very important in the United States. It allows for freedom of religion. Even though some people wanted to change the Constitution, I think it would be wrong to change it. It would go against what is already written.

I also think it is one of the only amendments that would limit people's freedom, not the government's. I do not think this is right.

I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. I do not know why the president is pushing for this. I think he is pushing for it because it is against his own beliefs as a Catholic. He is showing favoritism to one religion over others.

I think this is a matter for the churches to decide, not the government. There is no good reason for a law against marijuana. I do not see how it would help the economy. I think it might even help the society.

I have said what I think.

I have some ideas about the war in Iraq. I do not think the government was honest with the American people about why we went to war. Before we invaded Iraq, they said the war was about the September 11th terrorist attacks. But in reality, the two were not closely connected. The government used the emotions of the American people after the attack to make the war seem necessary.

I am against war and this one was no exception. I think the war in Iraq is similar to the Vietnam War in some ways. Both were long and difficult. The US government did not prepare for the aftermath of the war in Iraq. Many American soldiers died in the war. The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to put in a new one. But this was a hard and long process.

I do not think the US government was prepared for the problems it would face in Iraq. They should have learned from past mistakes. The US government was not honest about how long and difficult it would be to set up a democratic government in Iraq. They made it seem like it would be an easy thing to do.

It is hard to decide what to do now. We have been in Iraq for a long time and it is hard to leave. We took away their government and their way of life. But we also have to think about the American soldiers who are still dying. The US government should have thought more about the consequences of going to war.

I think the main reason for invading Iraq was to control their oil. This is one reason why we are not helping other countries become democratic.

I hope the war will end soon and there will be peace in Iraq. But this does not seem likely.

I am for gay marriage. I have always been. I think it is a personal choice and not something that should be limited by laws. Many studies show that being gay is not a choice, but a biological fact. It is not something a person can control.

I do not think politics and government should interfere with this issue. It is a personal and private matter, not a state or national issue. In my neighborhood, there are two or three openly gay couples who are not married because they cannot be. However, they live like any other family. They walk their dogs down the street like anyone else.

I think it is ridiculous for President Bush to try to decide what marriage means. Marriage is a personal relationship between two people, not something that the government should define.

Studies have shown that being gay is often a result of a chemical difference in the brain. It is something a person is born with and not something they choose. This is different from growing up in a certain way or being raised in a certain environment.

If two people, a man and a woman, want to get married, they can do so privately without telling anyone. But if two gay people want to get married, it is a big public issue. I think marriage should be a private matter, not something that is made public.

I am not for or against anything else about gay marriage. My only point is that people should be free to make their own choices and have their own relationships. The government should not interfere with this.

When you put something on the internet, it is seen by everyone. It is public. You cannot control who sees it. As a resident advisor, I have already dealt with this situation. You put something online, and it can affect how people think of you. If you talk about hurting yourself or others, someone will see it. They will report it to the school. The school must act. They cannot ignore it. If something bad happens, they could have stopped it.

But it's hard to know what to believe. Some people just joke around online. They may say things they do not mean. We had a situation at school like this. It was an experiment for a class. But it could be serious. Recently, something happened because someone overheard a student saying something in school. They called the school. We found the student who said it. His friend looked at his Facebook page and got worried. There were things on his page that he meant as a joke. But in this situation, it was serious.

When you put things on the internet, you have no privacy. If you do not want something on the internet, do not put it there. If you do not want someone to see it, do not post it. You cannot tell people what to think. You cannot say what is a joke or what is serious.

School officials should not friend their students on social media and look at their posts. But if a student brings something to their attention, they must take it seriously. They must protect the school. If there is danger, they must act. I do not think teachers should make a fake social media account to be friends with their students. That is not right. As a resident advisor, I do not want to know if my residents are doing things I do not agree with. I do not want to have to deal with it.

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The original goal was good, to help another country have democracy. 
But I think we lost sight of that goal a long time ago. 
Now we are fighting just to show we are strong. 
I don't think the reasons were good from the start. 
George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein. 
If our goal was to help a country without a fair government, that would have been good. 
But I think we have been fighting for too long. 
I think we made our point in the first few months. 
But now we have been fighting for years. 

If our goal was to help a country ruled by a bad leader, that would have been a good reason for the war. 
But I don't think that is our reason anymore. 
It seems we are fighting just to fight. 
We don't want to end the war without winning. 

I think the war should end. 
Their government should take care of itself. 
We are spending a lot of money on the war. 
We have our own problems, like poverty and poor roads. 
We should spend money on those things. 
War should not be in our budget for a long time. 

We spend billions of dollars on the war. 
We have many problems at home that need money. 
Things like schools, roads and health care need money. 
We should spend our money on those things, not on a war that is not important. 

That's my opinion.

Do you think it is right for schools to prevent students from having Myspace accounts? This is a question I want to ask.

I was thinking about this because someone found out about something on the internet. They looked at your Myspace and found out that you were in trouble. They were able to help prevent a bad thing from happening. I think this is good.

But then I started thinking, how do they know what to look for? If they are just looking at everyone's Myspace, it might not be fair. They might be looking at the wrong people. And it might be like profiling. They might be looking for bad people, but they might not be fair.

I don't think it is right for someone to have a job to look at everyone's Myspace all day. But I also think it is good that someone was able to help prevent a bad thing from happening.

I have a Facebook, but I don't have a Myspace. But I know that there are bad people who can see things about me on the internet. I saw a TV show about this. A man was trying to show how easy it is to get information about people on the internet. He found a girl's screen name and was talking to her on instant messenger in just a minute. I wouldn't meet someone like that, but I have had people in my classes who IM me and they know it's me. They know my name, what I look like, and where I am during the day. It's hard to know who can see your information.

I tried to limit what I put on Facebook, but I also want to be able to communicate with my friends. I don't want to limit it too much. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know on Facebook, but I don't know who can see my information.

I heard that some schools banned Myspace. I don't know if that is a good idea. I wasn't sure how schools had the right to tell students what they can and can't do on the internet. That doesn't seem like a good idea.

Is that all you have to say on this topic?

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War now. I was against it from the start. But I guess it's not important anymore. Mostly everyone agrees it was a bad idea, except the people in the administration. They do not want to say they made a mistake.

We can see this in the polls. The United States, Iraq and the world were asked if the war was a good idea. About 75 to 80% of people said no. Even 80% of Iraqis said no. 70% of U.S. troops think the war was a bad idea and we should leave soon.

I do not know what to say. The war was already a problem before we went in. And now, leaving will also be a problem. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East. We have different cultures and ways of life.

This administration and past administrations think they can bring democracy to places where it is not wanted. This is not how people in that area choose to live their lives. Saddam was a bad leader, but we should have thought about the good and bad before we invaded. The war made a big mess.

I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq. The administration has ideas about why we should stay. But I do not agree with them. If they want to leave slowly over a year, I would be okay with that. But I do not see a reason to stay.

Many Iraqis think we should leave within a year. Some even think we should leave now. We are trying to help them, but they are saying no. If we ask them what to do, and they say leave, then it is not our fault if things go wrong.

If we leave, we can try to help again. We will not be the heroes in the Middle East, but it will be better than now.

I think there is still a problem with gender discrimination in the United States. It is not just about women, though. I think it also depends on the kind of work you do.

For example, women often have a harder time getting jobs because of the "glass ceiling." Even though there is supposed to be equality, many people have a hard time working with a woman in charge. This is because society has been this way for a long time.

In the workplace, women may see a job they can do and meet the requirements, but the board may not choose to promote them because it has not been common for women to be in high positions. Some industries, like fashion, can also be difficult for men. It is not common for men to stay home with children, and people often look down on them for it.

In the fashion industry, some people do not take men seriously if they are straight. This is because men in fashion often have different styles of life. If a man in fashion has a typical style of life, people may question if he really knows about fashion.

It can be hard to change this because society has a set idea. However, people are slowly starting to accept women in business and men staying home with children. As women become more accepted in business, and men staying home become more accepted, it may become easier for people to see that both men and women can be good at different things.

It's also true that people from different areas or with different grammar skills can be discriminated against. For example, if someone from a farm with poor grammar becomes a CEO, other men may doubt his abilities because of his grammar.

I think that they didn't make marijuana legal 
They made it less serious 
From a crime to a traffic ticket 
You know, something you get a fine for but not jail time 
If you get caught with it, you might still have problems, like getting a job 
But it's not as bad as having a real crime 
Some people think it's better to make it less serious because it's expensive to put people in jail 
To book them, to feed them, to give them a lawyer 
It costs a lot of money 
And some cities are very against marijuana 
But Denver is more open-minded 
They think it's okay 
And it's good because they have more money now to help people 
For education, for the elderly, for the homeless 

I don't think marijuana should be everywhere 
But the financial side is a good reason to make it less serious 
Other reasons are that some people don't like it 
If it was totally legal, people might smoke it and drive 
And that's not safe 
And it's still not okay in many places to smoke marijuana 
So it would be awkward if it was out in the open

But marijuana can affect people's lives in other ways 
Not just their driving skills 
And people react differently to substances 
Some people can control themselves, but some can't 
It's hard to say how bad marijuana is because people are different 
But both marijuana and alcohol have their bad effects

I say yes. I believe this because many things they do are like old traditions. They do the same things for a long time. It's good to be connected to tradition, but it's also important to change with the times.

Many Catholics go to church every week. They are strict about how things are done. Sometimes I think the Catholic Church looks down on people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They also don't accept people from other religions.

For example, my parents wanted to get married in the Catholic Church, but they couldn't because my dad was not a Catholic. This is not very tolerant of other religions. We are taught to love others in the Catholic Church, but it seems hypocritical to say to love others and then not accept them.

I think a lot of Catholic teachings tell you to do things, but the way things are practiced goes against what is taught. This is because some things are old and outdated. But they continue to do things the old way.

I don't think allowing priests to marry would change their behavior. If someone wants to do something bad, like hurt a child, they will do it anyway. This is different from a marriage.

In conclusion, I don't think allowing priests to marry would stop people who want to hurt children from doing so.

I have not made up my mind on this issue.  I don't know if one side is right or wrong.  But I do think this is a difficult topic.  It is hard to decide how to define marriage without hurting anyone's feelings.

Something close to the issue of church and state makes it hard to decide.  We think marriage should be a special kind of partnership between two people.  It's like being baptized.  When people get baptized, they get special benefits.  We think married people should get special benefits too.

If two people are in a civil union, they should be treated the same as if they were married.  It doesn't matter if they are gay or not.  They are two people who love each other.

If all states can agree on what marriage means, then the government should make it a federal law.  But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is not a good idea.  It's a big decision and not worth changing the constitution for.

I don't think banning gay marriage is important enough to change the constitution.  We should not change something so important just because some people disagree with it.

I don't have an opinion on this issue.

I was raised in a Christian home. This makes homosexuality a complicated issue for me. I have many gay friends. I do not fully agree with their lifestyle. But I think it should be legal. It is not a national issue. Each state should decide for itself, not the president.

Many states are Democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how the state feels about this issue. I do not think you can disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there.

I believe homosexuals should have the same rights as heterosexuals. I think each state should decide about gay marriage.

I already answered that. I do not think the president should decide for the whole country. President Bush should not be able to say the whole country is against gay marriage. Each state should decide for itself.

I think some issues should be left to each individual state. The president does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state should be run.

I do not agree with President Bush's ban on gay marriage. It is not fair. He will be out of office soon. A new president may decide to lift the ban. It will go back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will live with the decision, not the president.

No, I do not agree with President Bush's ban on gay marriage.

The writer does not agree with the school officials' actions. They say that Myspace is a public place where people can share things with others. If someone posts something on Myspace, they should expect that others, including school officials, may see it.

School officials can see what students are doing on the internet, even if they use their own computers at home. In this case, the school officials went on the internet to prevent a school shooting. The writer believes that this was a good thing, as it may have saved lives.

The writer thinks that school officials have the right to go on the internet to check on students. If they go on the internet to catch students doing bad things, it is an invasion of privacy. But if they go on the internet to make the school a safer place, it is okay.

The writer likes to write more when they write. They say that it is easier to express themselves when they can write more. They also say that it is better to write than to talk.

The writer thinks it is silly to post something on Myspace and not expect to get in trouble. They say that everything can be seen by others, and it can come back to hurt them. They also say that once something is on the internet, it is always there.

The writer believes that school officials should not go on the internet just to catch students. But if they have a good reason, such as to make the school a safer place, it is okay. They also think that the police should be able to go on the internet to help the school officials.

The writer remembers when they went to high school. They had to do lock downs and drills to be safe. This was because of the possibility of a school shooting. The writer thinks that the school officials were just trying to make the school a safer place.

The writer is finished talking.

I have mixed feelings about the war in Iraq. At first, I was in favor of it because I was personally affected by the events of 9/11. I thought going to war would bring justice to those responsible. But now, I think we went there without a clear plan. We were not prepared for what we would face, and it backfired.

I think the people in Iraq are fighting each other. They cannot unite against us if they cannot even get along with themselves. I do not think our presence in Iraq is helping their situation.

Unfortunately, the events of 9/11 made me feel less concerned about what is happening in Iraq. I do not think they are like us and cannot be helped by us. They have a different way of thinking about war. I believe they are not looking to make their country better; they just want us to leave.

I think we went to war for revenge and not to help them. President Bush declared war on Iraq, and many people wanted to go to war because of what happened on 9/11. But I do not think we had a clear plan for what we would do after going to Iraq.

I think a better plan would have been to understand the situation in Iraq before we went there. We should have considered how their way of life would change and how they would react to our presence. We should have also considered what would happen after we left.

In the end, I do not think we are making enough progress in Iraq. We have made some progress, but it is not enough to justify staying there. I think the country will collapse once we leave, and we will be hurting ourselves by staying there.

The Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are leaving the Church because it is not very accepting of some things. The Church has strong views on issues like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old and not liked by many. If the Church changes its views, it will not lose its followers.

Some people are against the Church because of its views on these issues. They think the Church is wrong. The Church does not allow women to be priests and priests cannot be married. Many people think this is unfair. They believe everyone should have their own family and life outside of their job.

The Church says priests are married to God, but they do not need a family. However, this is not true for everyone else. Most people have jobs and families. They must balance work and family life. Priests should be able to do the same. 

The Church needs to be more open-minded and accept different views. This will help it keep its followers. The Church should not be against things that many people support, like gay marriage and birth control.

If the Church allows priests to be married and have families, it might not have had some problems. However, it is hard to know for sure. The Church's rules are very old and do not fit with modern society.

In the end, the Church should be more accepting of different views and allow priests to be married and have families. This will help it keep its followers and be more like other jobs and families.

I am not against gay marriage. I believe people are born the way they are, and it is not a choice. I think gay people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. I do not think it is fair to say one man and one woman can get married, but two people of the same sex cannot.

I do not think people have a choice in their sexual orientation. I was born straight, and others are born gay. It does not seem to be a decision they make.

I do not think the federal government should be involved in this issue. I do not see it as a matter of law or a moral issue. I do not think gay people should be judged or punished for being who they are.

I believe the government should stay out of people's private lives. It has nothing to do with the safety of the country. I do not see why they need to get involved. Gay people are who they are, and they should not be blamed for it.

I think gay marriage should be legalized. There is no good reason not to.

Some people think gay couples are a threat to the heterosexual family. But they are different. It's like two sides of the same coin. Heads will never be tails, but they are the same thing.

Gay couples have many of the same rights as others. They should be able to own property and get medical help when they are sick. But now, they can't be with their partner in the hospital.

This is not fair. A lot of scientific studies have been done on gay couples and they are just like other couples. They have the same things that make a relationship successful.

The problem is that some people don't want to let gay couples get married. They think it's against their religion. But the government should not be involved in church business. If a gay couple wants a marriage certificate, that's all they are asking for.

Just like the civil rights movement, this is about being separate but equal. Gay couples are the same as others in many ways.

Some people are worried about adoption and how it will affect the community. But this is not a good reason to deny gay couples the right to marry. They can be parents just like anyone else.

Children of gay couples are just like other children. They are influenced by their parents, but their parents' sexual orientation does not affect their parenting skills.

I think the government should be involved in making gay marriage legal in every state. The amendment to ban gay marriage is not right.

President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. He thinks it's against his religion. But his views are not the only ones that matter. Morality is different for everyone.

It's not right for the government to enforce one group's morality on the whole country. The government should be fair and equal for everyone.

Some people believe that gay people are damaged or have a personality defect. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says so.

We should listen to experts and not just what our friends and neighbors think. If we do, we will see the world in a different way.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. 
I think a drug's legal status does not decide if it is useful. 
So, if a drug is bad, it is bad, no matter if it is legal or not. 
I do not think marijuana should be available for the public. 
No, I do not think that. 
But, I do think it should be used for medical purposes. 
Because a drug is bad does not mean it has no good properties. 
There are many bad drugs that we use in the hospital. 
Like oxycotton, Vicodin, and Perocets. 
These are controlled substances, but they are useful. 
If we deny the good properties of marijuana just because it is illegal, that is not right. 

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. 
Abusing marijuana is bad, like abusing alcohol. 
But, if we make marijuana legal, people might use it responsibly. 
We should remove the bad image of marijuana first. 
Then, people might use it responsibly. 

People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. 
But, it is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. 
If we change people's image of marijuana, they might use it responsibly. 
And, it should be available for medical purposes.

The Catholic church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as it was before. I grew up going to church every Sunday. I would wear nice dresses and matching shoes. After I moved to a private school, I saw my friends there on weekends. We would attend church together.

Now, as I've grown older, the church has made some changes. They now have a shorter service, thirty minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. Some families come to church in beach clothes. Even in the morning services, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I've noticed is in the church I attend. I don't know much about the church's politics, but this is my experience.

Some people have accused the Catholic church of not doing enough to stop priests who commit pedophilia. People think that if the church allowed female priests or priests to get married, these problems might have been avoided.

I don't think this would have made a difference. There are married men who become pedophiles. It's the person, not the rules that cause the problem. When someone decides to become a priest, it's their choice. There are other religions that allow priests to get married, so if they want to get married, they can choose a different faith.

I think pedophilia is based on genetics. People are born with it, not made that way through upbringing. You can't change it by getting married. It may come out eventually. I don't think the church could have stopped this from happening. If they knew about it and tried to cover it up, that's wrong. But I don't think they always knew.

I don't have other thoughts about the Catholic church.

I was okay with the idea of going to war in Iraq at first. But I think everyone was still upset after the September 11th attacks. We went to war for reasons that I do not agree with.

The Bush administration connected the war to Osama Bin Laden and the September 11th attacks. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true.

This made me very upset. I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. It was not honest with us.

Even Colin Powell, the Secretary of State, said he was not convinced by the evidence when he presented it at the United Nations. This is wrong. It is a serious crime for the government to lie to its people.

I think the Bush administration does not care about the Constitution. They have been trying to weaken it since 2001.

The administration wanted to go to war for a long time. One of the Treasury Secretaries said in his book that President Bush was angry at Saddam Hussein because of his father. He wanted to expand our oil supply.

I think the war has gone on too long. But if we leave now, many more people may die. The country may fall into civil war.

The United States and the United Nations are trying a new plan. They want other countries in the area to help bring order to Iraq. But I am not sure this will work. Iraq's government may be weak and unable to control the country.

The news says the Parliament is not working well. The Prime Minister does not have much control. There are many groups fighting for power.

I do not have a solution to this problem.

I have some thoughts about the war in Iraq.  At this point, I think it is pointless.  It is not even a declared war.  I think it was started as a way to get back at Iraq because of the attacks on September 11.  I don't really know much about the war, but I know we are staying there to try and build a democracy.  We also want to get oil from them.

But I don't think it is worth it because it is making everyone upset.  If we stay, we have to try and build democracy, which will take a long time.  If we leave, they will be angry with us because we made their country bad.

I think the war should not be called a war anymore.  I think we are staying there to show that we are big and powerful.  But this is not a good reason to stay.

I do think we should try to help the people of Iraq.  But it is also wasting our resources.  The war is making President Bush look bad.  He is being compared to the president who started the Vietnam War, which was also not declared.

I know some families who have sons and daughters in Iraq.  I want the war to end, but I also don't want to leave them there.  It is hard to decide what to do.  If we stay, we might make things worse for the people of Iraq.

I think the war will go on for a long time.  It is a complicated issue.

I do not think it is right for a state to make marijuana legal. I think this is a matter for the churches. The United States Constitution says there must be a separation of church and state. This is clear. It is written in the Constitution. I think trying to make laws about marijuana would be against what the Constitution says.

Some people are against making marijuana illegal. They think it is a matter of which church you believe in. Many Catholics are against marijuana. They do not want it to be legal. But I do not think the government should decide what the churches can and cannot make illegal.

The idea of separation of church and state is very important in the United States. It allows for freedom of religion. Even though some people wanted to change the Constitution, I think it would be wrong to change it. It would go against what is already written.

I also think it is one of the only amendments that would limit people's freedom, not the government's. I do not think this is right.

I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. I do not know why the president is pushing for this. I think he is pushing for it because it is against his own beliefs as a Catholic. He is showing favoritism to one religion over others.

I think this is a matter for the churches to decide, not the government. There is no good reason for a law against marijuana. I do not see how it would help the economy. I think it might even help the society.

I have said what I think.

I have some ideas about the war in Iraq. I do not think the government was honest with the American people about why we went to war. Before we invaded Iraq, they said the war was about the September 11th terrorist attacks. But in reality, the two were not closely connected. The government used the emotions of the American people after the attack to make the war seem necessary.

I am against war and this one was no exception. I think the war in Iraq is similar to the Vietnam War in some ways. Both were long and difficult. The US government did not prepare for the aftermath of the war in Iraq. Many American soldiers died in the war. The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to put in a new one. But this was a hard and long process.

I do not think the US government was prepared for the problems it would face in Iraq. They should have learned from past mistakes. The US government was not honest about how long and difficult it would be to set up a democratic government in Iraq. They made it seem like it would be an easy thing to do.

It is hard to decide what to do now. We have been in Iraq for a long time and it is hard to leave. We took away their government and their way of life. But we also have to think about the American soldiers who are still dying. The US government should have thought more about the consequences of going to war.

I think the main reason for invading Iraq was to control their oil. This is one reason why we are not helping other countries become democratic.

I hope the war will end soon and there will be peace in Iraq. But this does not seem likely.

I am for gay marriage. I have always been. I think it is a personal choice and not something that should be limited by laws. Many studies show that being gay is not a choice, but a biological fact. It is not something a person can control.

I do not think politics and government should interfere with this issue. It is a personal and private matter, not a state or national issue. In my neighborhood, there are two or three openly gay couples who are not married because they cannot be. However, they live like any other family. They walk their dogs down the street like anyone else.

I think it is ridiculous for President Bush to try to decide what marriage means. Marriage is a personal relationship between two people, not something that the government should define.

Studies have shown that being gay is often a result of a chemical difference in the brain. It is something a person is born with and not something they choose. This is different from growing up in a certain way or being raised in a certain environment.

If two people, a man and a woman, want to get married, they can do so privately without telling anyone. But if two gay people want to get married, it is a big public issue. I think marriage should be a private matter, not something that is made public.

I am not for or against anything else about gay marriage. My only point is that people should be free to make their own choices and have their own relationships. The government should not interfere with this.

When you put something on the internet, it is seen by everyone. It is public. You cannot control who sees it. As a resident advisor, I have already dealt with this situation. You put something online, and it can affect how people think of you. If you talk about hurting yourself or others, someone will see it. They will report it to the school. The school must act. They cannot ignore it. If something bad happens, they could have stopped it.

But it's hard to know what to believe. Some people just joke around online. They may say things they do not mean. We had a situation at school like this. It was an experiment for a class. But it could be serious. Recently, something happened because someone overheard a student saying something in school. They called the school. We found the student who said it. His friend looked at his Facebook page and got worried. There were things on his page that he meant as a joke. But in this situation, it was serious.

When you put things on the internet, you have no privacy. If you do not want something on the internet, do not put it there. If you do not want someone to see it, do not post it. You cannot tell people what to think. You cannot say what is a joke or what is serious.

School officials should not friend their students on social media and look at their posts. But if a student brings something to their attention, they must take it seriously. They must protect the school. If there is danger, they must act. I do not think teachers should make a fake social media account to be friends with their students. That is not right. As a resident advisor, I do not want to know if my residents are doing things I do not agree with. I do not want to have to deal with it.

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The original goal was good, to help another country have democracy. 
But I think we lost sight of that goal a long time ago. 
Now we are fighting just to show we are strong. 
I don't think the reasons were good from the start. 
George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein. 
If our goal was to help a country without a fair government, that would have been good. 
But I think we have been fighting for too long. 
I think we made our point in the first few months. 
But now we have been fighting for years. 

If our goal was to help a country ruled by a bad leader, that would have been a good reason for the war. 
But I don't think that is our reason anymore. 
It seems we are fighting just to fight. 
We don't want to end the war without winning. 

I think the war should end. 
Their government should take care of itself. 
We are spending a lot of money on the war. 
We have our own problems, like poverty and poor roads. 
We should spend money on those things. 
War should not be in our budget for a long time. 

We spend billions of dollars on the war. 
We have many problems at home that need money. 
Things like schools, roads and health care need money. 
We should spend our money on those things, not on a war that is not important. 

That's my opinion.

Do you think it is right for schools to prevent students from having Myspace accounts? This is a question I want to ask.

I was thinking about this because someone found out about something on the internet. They looked at your Myspace and found out that you were in trouble. They were able to help prevent a bad thing from happening. I think this is good.

But then I started thinking, how do they know what to look for? If they are just looking at everyone's Myspace, it might not be fair. They might be looking at the wrong people. And it might be like profiling. They might be looking for bad people, but they might not be fair.

I don't think it is right for someone to have a job to look at everyone's Myspace all day. But I also think it is good that someone was able to help prevent a bad thing from happening.

I have a Facebook, but I don't have a Myspace. But I know that there are bad people who can see things about me on the internet. I saw a TV show about this. A man was trying to show how easy it is to get information about people on the internet. He found a girl's screen name and was talking to her on instant messenger in just a minute. I wouldn't meet someone like that, but I have had people in my classes who IM me and they know it's me. They know my name, what I look like, and where I am during the day. It's hard to know who can see your information.

I tried to limit what I put on Facebook, but I also want to be able to communicate with my friends. I don't want to limit it too much. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know on Facebook, but I don't know who can see my information.

I heard that some schools banned Myspace. I don't know if that is a good idea. I wasn't sure how schools had the right to tell students what they can and can't do on the internet. That doesn't seem like a good idea.

Is that all you have to say on this topic?

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War now. I was against it from the start. But I guess it's not important anymore. Mostly everyone agrees it was a bad idea, except the people in the administration. They do not want to say they made a mistake.

We can see this in the polls. The United States, Iraq and the world were asked if the war was a good idea. About 75 to 80% of people said no. Even 80% of Iraqis said no. 70% of U.S. troops think the war was a bad idea and we should leave soon.

I do not know what to say. The war was already a problem before we went in. And now, leaving will also be a problem. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East. We have different cultures and ways of life.

This administration and past administrations think they can bring democracy to places where it is not wanted. This is not how people in that area choose to live their lives. Saddam was a bad leader, but we should have thought about the good and bad before we invaded. The war made a big mess.

I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq. The administration has ideas about why we should stay. But I do not agree with them. If they want to leave slowly over a year, I would be okay with that. But I do not see a reason to stay.

Many Iraqis think we should leave within a year. Some even think we should leave now. We are trying to help them, but they are saying no. If we ask them what to do, and they say leave, then it is not our fault if things go wrong.

If we leave, we can try to help again. We will not be the heroes in the Middle East, but it will be better than now.

I think there is still a problem with gender discrimination in the United States. It is not just about women, though. I think it also depends on the kind of work you do.

For example, women often have a harder time getting jobs because of the "glass ceiling." Even though there is supposed to be equality, many people have a hard time working with a woman in charge. This is because society has been this way for a long time.

In the workplace, women may see a job they can do and meet the requirements, but the board may not choose to promote them because it has not been common for women to be in high positions. Some industries, like fashion, can also be difficult for men. It is not common for men to stay home with children, and people often look down on them for it.

In the fashion industry, some people do not take men seriously if they are straight. This is because men in fashion often have different styles of life. If a man in fashion has a typical style of life, people may question if he really knows about fashion.

It can be hard to change this because society has a set idea. However, people are slowly starting to accept women in business and men staying home with children. As women become more accepted in business, and men staying home become more accepted, it may become easier for people to see that both men and women can be good at different things.

It's also true that people from different areas or with different grammar skills can be discriminated against. For example, if someone from a farm with poor grammar becomes a CEO, other men may doubt his abilities because of his grammar.

I think that they didn't make marijuana legal 
They made it less serious 
From a crime to a traffic ticket 
You know, something you get a fine for but not jail time 
If you get caught with it, you might still have problems, like getting a job 
But it's not as bad as having a real crime 
Some people think it's better to make it less serious because it's expensive to put people in jail 
To book them, to feed them, to give them a lawyer 
It costs a lot of money 
And some cities are very against marijuana 
But Denver is more open-minded 
They think it's okay 
And it's good because they have more money now to help people 
For education, for the elderly, for the homeless 

I don't think marijuana should be everywhere 
But the financial side is a good reason to make it less serious 
Other reasons are that some people don't like it 
If it was totally legal, people might smoke it and drive 
And that's not safe 
And it's still not okay in many places to smoke marijuana 
So it would be awkward if it was out in the open 
Alcohol is bad for your driving, too 
But marijuana can affect people's lives in other ways 
Not just their driving skills 
And people react differently to substances 
Some people can control themselves, but some can't 
It's hard to say how bad marijuana is because people are different 
But both marijuana and alcohol have their bad effects

I say yes. I believe this because many things they do are like old traditions. They do the same things for a long time. It's good to be connected to tradition, but it's also important to change with the times.

Many Catholics go to church every week. They are strict about how things are done. Sometimes I think the Catholic Church looks down on people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They also don't accept people from other religions.

For example, my parents wanted to get married in the Catholic Church, but they couldn't because my dad was not a Catholic. This is not very tolerant of other religions. We are taught to love others in the Catholic Church, but it seems hypocritical to say to love others and then not accept them.

I think a lot of Catholic teachings tell you to do things, but the way things are practiced goes against what is taught. This is because some things are old and outdated. But they continue to do things the old way.

I don't think allowing priests to marry would change their behavior. If someone wants to do something bad, like hurt a child, they will do it anyway. This is different from a marriage.

In conclusion, I don't think allowing priests to marry would stop people who want to hurt children from doing so.

I have not made up my mind on this issue.  I don't know if one side is right or wrong.  But I do think this is a difficult topic.  It is hard to decide how to define marriage without hurting anyone's feelings.

Something close to the issue of church and state makes it hard to decide.  We think marriage should be a special kind of partnership between two people.  It's like being baptized.  When people get baptized, they get special benefits.  We think married people should get special benefits too.

If two people are in a civil union, they should be treated the same as if they were married.  It doesn't matter if they are gay or not.  They are two people who love each other.

If all states can agree on what marriage means, then the government should make it a federal law.  But changing the constitution to ban gay marriage is not a good idea.  It's a big decision and not worth changing the constitution for.

I don't think banning gay marriage is important enough to change the constitution.  We should not change something so important just because some people disagree with it.

I don't have an opinion on this issue.

I was raised in a Christian home. This makes homosexuality a complicated issue for me. I have many gay friends. I do not fully agree with their lifestyle. But I think it should be legal. It is not a national issue. Each state should decide for itself, not the president.

Many states are Democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how the state feels about this issue. I do not think you can disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there.

I believe homosexuals should have the same rights as heterosexuals. I think each state should decide about gay marriage.

I already answered that. I do not think the president should decide for the whole country. President Bush should not be able to say the whole country is against gay marriage. Each state should decide for itself.

I think some issues should be left to each individual state. The president does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state should be run.

I do not agree with President Bush's ban on gay marriage. It is not fair. He will be out of office soon. A new president may decide to lift the ban. It will go back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will live with the decision, not the president.

No, I do not agree with President Bush's ban on gay marriage.

The writer does not agree with the school officials' actions. They say that Myspace is a public place where people can share things with others. If someone posts something on Myspace, they should expect that others, including school officials, may see it.

School officials can see what students are doing on the internet, even if they use their own computers at home. In this case, the school officials went on the internet to prevent a school shooting. The writer believes that this was a good thing, as it may have saved lives.

The writer thinks that school officials have the right to go on the internet to check on students. If they go on the internet to catch students doing bad things, it is an invasion of privacy. But if they go on the internet to make the school a safer place, it is okay.

The writer likes to write more when they write. They say that it is easier to express themselves when they can write more. They also say that it is better to write than to talk.

The writer thinks it is silly to post something on Myspace and not expect to get in trouble. They say that everything can be seen by others, and it can come back to hurt them. They also say that once something is on the internet, it is always there.

The writer believes that school officials should not go on the internet just to catch students. But if they have a good reason, such as to make the school a safer place, it is okay. They also think that the police should be able to go on the internet to help the school officials.

The writer remembers when they went to high school. They had to do lock downs and drills to be safe. This was because of the possibility of a school shooting. The writer thinks that the school officials were just trying to make the school a safer place.

The writer is finished talking.

I have mixed feelings about the war in Iraq. At first, I was in favor of it because I was personally affected by the events of 9/11. I thought going to war would bring justice to those responsible. But now, I think we went there without a clear plan. We were not prepared for what we would face, and it backfired.

I think the people in Iraq are fighting each other. They cannot unite against us if they cannot even get along with themselves. I do not think our presence in Iraq is helping their situation.

Unfortunately, the events of 9/11 made me feel less concerned about what is happening in Iraq. I do not think they are like us and cannot be helped by us. They have a different way of thinking about war. I believe they are not looking to make their country better; they just want us to leave.

I think we went to war for revenge and not to help them. President Bush declared war on Iraq, and many people wanted to go to war because of what happened on 9/11. But I do not think we had a clear plan for what we would do after going to Iraq.

I think a better plan would have been to understand the situation in Iraq before we went there. We should have considered how their way of life would change and how they would react to our presence. We should have also considered what would happen after we left.

In the end, I do not think we are making enough progress in Iraq. We have made some progress, but it is not enough to justify staying there. I think the country will collapse once we leave, and we will be hurting ourselves by staying there.
